body: REPLY TO LEGAL NOTICE UNDER SECTION 138 NI ACT
Subject: Reply to your Legal Notice dated {{notice_date}} under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881
Under instructions from and on behalf of my client {{client_name}}, I write this reply to your legal notice dated {{notice_date}} concerning Cheque No. {{cheque_number}} for ₹{{cheque_amount}}.
2. At the outset, my client denies each and every allegation made in your notice as false, frivolous, and legally untenable.
5. Your notice is misconceived and does not fulfill the requirements of a valid legal notice under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.
6. The cheque in question was not issued towards discharge of any legally enforceable debt or liability. Therefore, the statutory presumption under Section 139 of the NI Act does not arise.
7. Even if the cheque was issued (which is denied), it was issued under coercion, undue influence, fraud, or for purposes other than discharge of debt.
8. Your demand for payment is wholly unjustified and unwarranted. My client is under no legal obligation to make any payment to you.
9. This reply is being issued within the statutory period to contest the false and baseless allegations made in your notice.
10. My client reserves all rights to defend any proceedings that may be initiated and to claim damages for issuance of a false and vexatious legal notice.
You are advised to verify the facts before initiating any legal proceedings, which will be defended on merits.
